Retail side, According to @bitpanda, retail portfolios vary between 20K–50K euros on average. One of the reasons why their portfolios are so large is because more than half of them are early adopters and were able to buy these assets at much lower prices than the current ones.

@polychaincap is one of the leading crypto-asset hedge funds. It was founded in 2016 and reached close to $1 billion assets under management in early 2018.The hedge fund's ROI since inception netted a positive performance of 1,332%. pic.twitter.com/Xl9E80QcBZ

Crypto-assets are known to have massive fluctuations in price. Hedge funds have the ability to use their know-how to turn these fluctuations into their favor and increase alpha generation for their clients. Depending on the strategies of the hedge fund, the returns vary. pic.twitter.com/3tt5fFehBN

The median crypto hedge fund in Q1 2019 had $4.3 million AuM and only 10% of the hedge funds are managing over $50 million. The median AuM in 2019 has a year-on-year growth of 358% from 2018, and it is expected to increase further in 2020 as the market matures.
